page.title: 10TEXTILES-GALSTON
page.content: There is a strong tradition in textile manufacturing in the Valley.At its peak in the late 19th century over 400 people worked in 6 mills in the production of lace,madras and woollen goods.This is now fallen to 108 people in 2 mills which produce woollen goods only.One mill specialises in Aran and Shetland products.The goods are produced for a foreign market and go abroad by road.The second mill uses wool and acrylic to produce jumpers with sporting motifs for a home market.The employees are predominantly female.Of the total work force 88% are female and 12% male. Their present locations reflect the former water power requirements.
